text: one interesting anecdote is the whole
Atkins diet craze Atkins and and we
needn't talk about the merits or lack
thereof in a just cut carbohydrate
approach to dieting although I will note
that everything from lentils to lli
poops is carbohydrates so that kind of
sums up my view on that topic um but
let's face it it became a very popular
diet in particular after a cover story
in the New York Times magazine what if
fat doesn't make us fat by Gary tabs the
diet took off into the stratosphere it
went from millions of readers to tens of
millions of readers what
happened what happened was every
supermarket in America filled up with
low carbohydrate Foods now frankly folks
and I trust you figured this out by
yourselves um most of this was high
calorie low carbohydrate crap but it was
there for your uh selection and the
interesting thing about this was there
was no policy reform there was no
legislation that Congress passed that
said every Supermarket must offer low
carb food every supermarket in America
filled up with low carb food for one
reason and one reason only you wanted it
maybe not you personally we wanted our
society wanted it we talk about the food
supply as if it's the Himalayas as if
it's this immutable thing it's not there
is one thing that very reliably trumps
the food supply and that is the food
demand because at the end of the day the
business of business is business and
they're just trying to keep the customer
satisfied it depends what we want now
the problem in our current mess is we
want all the wrong stuff why do we want
the wrong stuff well because taste buds
are very malleable little fellas they
learn to like what they know we're
bathing our taste buds in too much sugar
too much salt too much processed food
all day long that's what they know and
crave and this in its own right is a
complicated and potentially lengthy
topic the average breakfast cereal in
the United States is saltier than your
diet should be if breakfast cereal is
pulling your average up what the heck is
going to pull it down there are many
pasta sauces that have more added sugar
than ice cream topping should diabetics
eat as much ice cream topping as they
want but run like health when they see a
jar of marinara sauce I mean you know
we've created a food supply that's
pretty cockamamy but the result of it is
if you're getting all this sugar when
you eat pasta sauce just imagine how
much sugar you need at dessert time to
feel satisfied so that changes your
demand and then the food supply matches
your demand which exacerbates your
demand which further erodes the supply
the solution to a lot of this is
illumination knowing what's actually in
your food knowing how it affects what
you prefer because taste buds are
malleable little fellas and when they
can't be with the foods they love they
learn to love the foods they're with and
you can rehabilitate them you can learn
to love food Closer To Nature and when
you do that you actually taste the salt
and breakfast cereal I can't eat those
cereals anymore and neither can my
family and neither can most of my
patients you actually taste the sugar
and pasta sauce you won't want those
pasta sauces or those salad dressings
and when you rehabilitate your diet and
your taste buds you need a lot less
sugar at dessert time to feel satisfied
and need a lot less salt when you're
salting things to feel satisfied your
demand changes suddenly you're shopping
for different foods well now if you do
that all by yourself you're going to
have to work hard with the current food
supply to find what you're looking for
but if we can make the identification
and selection of healthful foods the
cultural norm if we can make it a craze
the way the Atkins diet was a craze
every supermarket in the United States
will reliably fill up with more
wholesome food to satisfy the demand so
one anecdote is a natural experiment we
had the Atkins diet it made people want
low carb food whether it was an
enlightened desire is a different story
but people wanted it the supply made it
available that's very encouraging now
all we need to do is get everybody to
want nutritious food and I suspect the
food supply will come
around
